alert.note: Alert for Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 12:00PM EDT until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Bay, Midland and Saginaw. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 AM EDT, Multiple rounds of thunderstorms containing heavy rain have moved across the area over the past 24 hours. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen during this time. This will lead to some areas of urban and small stream flooding. Street flooding has been reported in the Bay City. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to one half inch will be possible this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Saginaw, Midland, Bay City, Frankenmuth, Chesaning, Auburn, St. Charles, Birch Run, Pinconning, Coleman, Sanford, Freeland, Kawkawlin, Essexville, Edenville, Zilwaukee, Bentley, Merrill, Oakley and Linwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
